DOCNAME: CASE OF ÖZER AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . In DATE , ORG and Highways ( PERSON ) , a ORG body responsible , inter alia , for motorway construction , expropriated a part of a plot of land in GPE belonging to the applicants and several other persons . A committee of experts assessed the value of the applicants’ land and the sum fixed thereby was paid when the expropriation took place .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants , along with CARDINAL coowners , lodged a case with ORG , requesting increased compensation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the plaintiffs additional compensation of MONEY ( TRL ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) plus interest at the statutory rate applicable at the date of the court ’s decision , running from DATE . The amount of compensation that was awarded to the applicants was ORG ( approximately EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of the first - instance court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the administration paid the plaintiffs a total of GPE CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( approximately ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) . The applicants received TRL MONEY ( approximately EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice are set out in the Aka v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINAL-VI , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) .
